Marvel and Diana Bowers-SmithBrooklyn CollectionBrooklyn Collection128 Pierrepont StBrooklyn, NY 11201bcref@bklynlibrary.orgThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2021-01-12T18:01:54engDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Brooklyn Collection
Class Photograph Collection BCMS.0029
0.72 Cubic feet in 1 flat box
1904-2002 The Class Photograph Collection consists of group photographs from Brooklyn schools, spanning the years 1904-2002. 1
Accruals
Accruals are expected; the finding aid will be updated as more class photographs are acquired.
Provenance
This is a synthetic collection that has had and will continue to have accruals. The original group was purchased from Brian Merlis in April of 2013.
Related Materials
Also at the Brooklyn Collection:
Clippings files arranged by school name
Ephemera files arranged by school name
Yearbook Collection
High School Newspaper Collection
Arrangement
The collection is arranged alphabetically by school name.
Access
Collection is located in the Brooklyn Collection at the Central Branch at Grand Army Plaza. The collection may only be used in the library and is not available through interlibrary loan. Requests to view the collection must be made at least 48 hours in advance of visit.
Use
While many items in the Brooklyn Collection are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The borrower assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
Scope and Contents
This small collection documents graduating classes at various public and private schools in Brooklyn. Additionally, there are two photographs of the staff of Boys High School's student publication, the Recorder. Some photographs list student names on the verso, but most do not.
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as the Class Photograph Collection, Brooklyn Public Library â€“ Brooklyn Collection.
